Package org.dyn4j.collision.broadphase

Sub package of the Collision package handling broad-phase collision detection.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    BroadphaseDetector<E extends Collidable>
    Represents a broad-phase collision detection algorithm.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractAABBDetector<E extends Collidable>
    Abstract implementation of a BroadphaseDetector providing AABB (Axis Aligned Bounding Box) detection methods.
    BroadphasePair<E>
    Represents a pair of Collidables that have been detected as colliding in the BroadphaseDetector.
    DynamicAABBTree<E extends Collidable>
    Implementation of an axis-aligned bounding box tree.
    SapBruteForce<E extends Collidable>
    Implementation of the Sweep and Prune broad-phase collision detection algorithm.
    SapIncremental<E extends Collidable>
    Implementation of the Sweep and Prune broad-phase collision detection algorithm.
    SapTree<E extends Collidable>
    Implementation of the Sweep and Prune broad-phase collision detection algorithm.

Package org.dyn4j.collision.broadphase Description

Sub package of the Collision package handling broad-phase collision detection.

Currently there are three broadphase implementations: SapIncremental, SapBruteForce, and DynamicAABBTree.

A BroadphaseDetector should accept a list of Collidables and return those pairs who may be penetrating in a list of BroadphasePairs.

BroadphaseDetectors are not expected to be accurate, but are expected to be conservative. Meaning, its acceptable for a BroadphaseDetector to return false positives.

Typical applications will want to use the DynamicAABBTree class since it has double the performance than the other two in raycasting at minimal performance decrease in general collision detection. If raycasting is not a large portion of the application, then use of SapIncremental is advised because of its performance benefits when objects are moving either rarely or not at all. Finally, if constant performance is required use SapBruteForce.

Since:
1.0.0
Version:
3.0.0
Author:
William Bittle
